thread.title: Boxing: Manny Pacquiao to fight Amir Khan
thread.title_full: Boxing: Manny Pacquiao to fight Amir Khan

author: Adam Santarossa
title: Boxing: Manny Pacquiao to fight Amir Khan
text:
MANNY Pacquiao has announced he has agreed terms for a fight with British star Amir Khan on April 23. 
That news kills any hope of Australian Jeff Horn entering the ring with the Filipino legend on the same date in Brisbane.
Pacquiao’s promoter Bob Arum had been in negotiations with Horn’s handlers, Duco Events, for a fight with Horn at Brisbane’s Suncorp Stadium, but that dream is now dead.
Horn announced the news of the Pacquiao fight at a press conference last month and had begun promoting the showdown.
But the Filipino legend took to Twitter to announce he had reached an agreement with Khan and it’s expected to be held in the United Arab Emirates.
“Negotiations between team Pacquiao and team Khan have come to terms for the April 23 bout as this is what the fans wanted,” Pacquiao tweeted.
My team an I have agreed terms with Manny Pacquiao and his team for a super fight #pacquiaokhan #April23rd 
— Amir Khan (@amirkingkhan) February 26, 2017 Pacquiao recently took to the social media platform to conduct a poll of his fans to see who he should face next.
It was British superstar Khan who reigned supreme, as Horn obtained just seven per cent of the votes.
Who do you want me to fight next in the UAE?
— Manny Pacquiao (@mannypacquiao) February 12, 2017 Khan has been a world champion at welterweight, light welterweight and lightweight and his last fight was at middleweight against Mexican superstar Saul “Canelo” Alvarez.
That fight ended in an emphatic knockout defeat, but his showdown with Pacquaio is expected to be a much more of an even contest.
Although social media expects Khan to be up against it when the pair step into the ring together on April 23.
@amirkingkhan Can't wait to see this again #pacquiaokhan #April23rd pic.twitter.com/9lOjanXQD7 
— Connor (@ConnorWilson7) February 26, 2017 Does Amir Khan actually enjoy being put to sleep in front of millions? I respect his balls, but Pacquiao? Tf #PacquiaoKhan 
— Michael Panter (@MichaelPanter5) February 23, 2017 Amir Khan the worlds most high profile punch bag, Pacquiao knocking on but has plenty for that glass jaw #PacquiaoKhan 
— Liam Flecknor (@LiamFleck) February 23, 2017 The pair were stablemates in the past, when they both were trained by legendary boxing trainer Freddie Roach at the Wildcard Gym in Los Angeles.
Pacquiao and Khan used to regularly spar each other in the lead-up to fights and a clash has long been touted.
Both have similar styles, and are loved by fans due to the all-action approach each use inside in the ring.
The news come just hours after Jeff Horn’s camp made a desperate attempt to get Pacquiao to honour the commitment in Brisbane.
Horn released a video designed to taunt the Filipino fighter and lure him into the ring.
“Manny, I know you like money,” Horn says as he flashes a wad of cash in the YouTube video. “It’s slightly less than $38 million, but millions all the same.
“But our millions are real. We’ll even throw in a counter when you get around to signing our deal. We’ve got government backing to stage the event, but you need to be focused on boxing.”
The entertaining video is spliced with clips of United States President Donald Trump and shots of Brisbane.
But it has proven useless in the end, as Pacquiao now moves to a showdown in the Middle East with Khan.
Pac-man keeping his distance 0:31 Boxing: Manny Pacquiao looks to have no intentions of fighting Jeff Horn after another tweet saying he will fight Amir Khan.
